      static java.lang.String toDateRange(java.util.Date date1, java.util.Date date2)
      Converts two Date objects to a string representation of the date range using the following rules: If date2 is null or date1 == date2: "1 Aug 2003" If date1 and date2 have the same month and year: "1 - 5 Aug 2003" If date1 and date2 have the same year: "1 Aug - 6 Sep 2003" If date1 and date2 are completely different: "1 Aug 2002 - 7 Sep 2003"

      • toDateRange

        public static java.lang.String toDateRange(java.util.Date date1,
                                           java.util.Date date2)
        Converts two Date objects to a string representation of the date range using the following rules: If date2 is null or date1 == date2: "1 Aug 2003" If date1 and date2 have the same month and year: "1 - 5 Aug 2003" If date1 and date2 have the same year: "1 Aug - 6 Sep 2003" If date1 and date2 are completely different: "1 Aug 2002 - 7 Sep 2003"
        Parameters:
        date1 - the start date
        date2 - the end date
        Returns:
        a String representation of the date range

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object object,
                                        boolean returnNulls)
        Parameters:
        object - Any object to convert to string
        returnNulls - by default returns an empty string; true will return null
        Returns:
        string value the string value converted

      • toList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> toList(java.lang.String string,
                                                      java.lang.String delimeter)
        parses a string to a list of strings given a delimiter. NOTE: will handle if 2 separators and return an empty value Example: ,,2,3 will return 2 empty strings for index 1 & 2 then values 2 and 3 as a string for index 3 & 4.
        Parameters:
        string - the original string.
        delimeter - the delimter to separate strings on
        Returns:
        list of string values

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(double val,
                                        int places)
        Rounds the double value to the speicified decimal points and returns that number of decimal points as a String. For example: 4 to 2 places would return 4.00
        Parameters:
        val - : the double value to set the number of decimal digits for
        places - : the number of decimal digits to set
        Returns:
        String containing the right number of digits for the number

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(long val,
                                        int places)
        Rounds the long value to the speicified decimal points and returns that number of decimal points as a String. For example: 4 to 2 places would return 4.00
        Parameters:
        val - : the long value to set the number of decimal digits for
        places - : the number of decimal digits to set
        Returns:
        String containing the right number of digits for the number
